front.title: Expressing Registry Origin AS Information in RDAP

abstract.t: This document describes an extension to RDAP to query and express origin autonomous system numbers placed on network registrations.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: The American Registry for Internet Numbers (ARIN) accepts a list of Autonomous System (AS) numbers as an attribute of network objects when they are registered. The intent of these AS numbers is to signify an AS originating a route for the network. This document specifies an extension to express this information in RDAP network objects and a method to query RDAP network objects registered with these AS numbers.

section.title: RDAP Extension Identifier
section.t: This document uses the RDAP extension identifier "arin_originas0" in accordance with Section 5 of and Section 2.1 of . The registration for the identifier can be found in in accordance with Section 8.1 of .

section.title: Networks By Origin AS Query
section.t: While RDAP has defined queries to retreive networks and autonomous system numbers by their identifiers, the base RDAP specification does not contain a query to retreive a set of network objects for which an AS number has been associated as an origination in network routing.

This extension defines a query to retreive a set of network objects given an AS number, where the AS number has been registered as originating a route (i.e. origin AS). This query has the following syntax:
arin_originas0_networksbyoriginas/<autonomous system number>
The expected result from the query is defined in .

section.title: Networks and Orgin AS Information in RDAP
section.t: This extension defines two new JSON data structures for RDAP. The first is an array of networks (similar to the arrays found in Section 8 of , and the second is an array of origin AS numbers to be placed in network objects.

section.title: Network Search Results
section.t: The set of networks returned by the query in is represented by an array named "arin_originas0_networkSearchResults". Each item of the array is to be an IP network as defined by Section 5.4 of .

section.title: Origin AS Numbers
section.t: Each IP network defined in Section 5.4 of may contain an array named "arin_originas0_originautnums". This array contains number reprensenting an Autonomous System (AS). The array may be empty, but if allowed by policy should always be present in both the result of query specified in and any other RDAP query where an IP network object is given.
